title: Electric potential - V when E is proportional to x

content.question: The electric field in a region of space is given by <math alttext="vector E of x, equals b x times i hat" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>E</mi><mo>â†’</mo></mover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></math>, where <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> is a positive constant. If the electric potential <math alttext="V of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>V</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> is taken to be zero at <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, what is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction with numerator V of 3 centimeters, and denominator V of 1 centimeter, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>V</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mrow><mrow><mi>V</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mrow></mfrac></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
